overview: The caseback engravings on the 7177 differ entirely from those of the 7176 variants.

variations.title: Center Text: The 7177 swapped a large Porsche Design logo for a smaller one, added Orfina to the text, and had “Military Chronograph 7177 MOD. DEP. INT. ” stamped on the back.
variations.note: Specifically for the Venezuelan, UAE, and BUND-issued variants, there are unique caseback engravings, which will be discussed in their respective headings.

list.title: For the outer engraving, the text differed as well:
7176 S Perimeter Text:
list.text:
“7176 S CHRONOGRAPH AUTOMATIC
WATERRESISTANT TESTED 10 ATM SHOCKPROTECTED STAINLESS
STEEL SWISS MADE”

list.title: 7177 Perimeter Text:
list.text:
"WATERRESISTANT TESTED 10 ATM
AUTOMATIC SHOCKPROTECTED STAINLESS STEEL SWISS MADE”

list.title: There are two variations of the standard 7177 caseback that have been found.
Mk. 1 Variant: “7177”
list.text: Engraved in the 4th line of text.

list.title: Mk. 2 Variant: “7177”
list.text: Engraved in the 5th line of text.

list.title: Serial Numbers: Present on these models.
All 7177 variants
list.text:
include a stamped serial number, which is found in
groupings for particular dial configurations.

list.title: All serial numbers
list.text:
across all 7177 variants are sequential. However, there
are three sets of serial counts, possibly four that we have identified.
